messages.message:
X-posting for visibility, git operations could fail with a `Host key verification failed` error, as Github has rotated their RSA SSH host key today. More details about the change and steps to update the key: https://github.blog/2023-03-23-we-updated-our-rsa-ssh-host-key/

https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CCY413CSU/p1679639811401179?thread_ts=1679639379.211499&cid=CCY413CSU
So what do we do? Can’t pull master
You need to follow the steps in the linked GitHub blog post

Here’s the commands needed to run
```ssh-keygen -R github.com (http://github.com)
curl -L https://api.github.com/meta | jq -r '.ssh_keys | .[]' | sed -e 's/^/github.com /' >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts```

https://www.reddit.com/r/programming/comments/120asrs/comment/jdjgfu0/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web2x&context=3
```And now docs.github.com (http://docs.github.com), where people are supposed to get the new keys, is causing HSTS errors.

Great job.```
:rip:
